p: Currently, most of the planet’s natural ecosystems, to variable degrees, are the footprint of human activities. Artificially modified ecosystems are maintained by humans to satisfy their food needs or feed the various food production chains. These agro-systems are recognized as fragile because they are devoid of species diversity, which is an essential element for maintaining dynamic equilibrium and is often characterized by natural ecosystems ( Norris, 2012). In 1989, Croatian researcher Mirko D. Gmerk introduced the term “pathocenosis” to refer to the imbalance in the relationship between infectious diseases and the environment ( Grmek, 1995).
